Cannot play on older system; you'll need mad-powerful processor to render this.  Horrible frame drop/stutter and audio a dozen or more seconds out of sync.  MPC & VLC both pegging processor use @100%; that's a core2 duo @ 3 GHz under winXP; only using ~170-200 MB RAM, but video card is GeForce 7600 ... all sorts of raw power available, but it's not enough by a long shot.  Yes:DID play with codecs & outputs to tweak. No joy.

Props for the U/L, though.  Video quality, when rendered, is stunning, audio rich.  Have D/L'd several other aoloffline torrents, & they have been Really Good (thus, why I grabbed this one ... I was expecting high quality).

Time to throw my crappy old box away, I guess .. just can't keep up with the latest l33tz hardwarez specs.

;-)

Great torrent perfect size good info thanks a ton! Will seed for a long time!

Am I the only one who owns headphones?  

It seems the entire center channel has been mixed much more heavily into the right channel that the left.  And there's only one (two channel) audio track.  I say again:  The dialog audio is horribly imbalanced, leaning heavily to the right.

*Other* than that, it's perfect.  Generally with 1080p H.264 video (like this), I need to use  the VDPAU video playback hardware acceleration with my Nvidia video card to play it smoothly.  Works great with mplayer under linux (ubuntu maverick).  If the H.264 software decoder were multi-threaded, it might work without hardware acceleration, but the one I have is not, and a single (of my four) core can't do it alone.  

Check your CPU usage, and if you've got a pinned core, don't complain about video quality.
